title: Bug 3666 - Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description: Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature in jresdk 106 eats too much code. When using the code assist feature in the enclosed class, a programmer must add a parameter to the 'baz' call in the 'bar' function to make the program correct. The UI should have an option to control the amount of source code to replace when using the code assist feature. Currently, this option is missing.
OB: When using the code assist feature in the provided class and following the steps below:
EB: The code assist should only suggest adding 'foo()' as a parameter to the 'baz' call in the 'bar' function.
SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Change the 'baz' call in 'bar' to 'baz(x.x.foo())'. 2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'. 3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up the code assist feature. 4. The list of suggestions should appear. 5. Type 'f' to filter the list. 6. Select 'foo()' from the filtered list.
